column2: IOWA DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column8: Two-way Traffic

column2: 2. This sign means:
column8: 270 degree turn ahead.

column2: 3. Drivers should use the horn:
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column8: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column10: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.

column2: 4. When driving on a roadway with a single broken white line:
column4: you may cross the broken white line to change lanes.
column6: you may change lanes only if you are in the right lane.
column8: you may not cross the broken white line.

column2: 5. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column8: pass red lights.

column2: 6. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 7. When you see this sign you should:
column4: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column6: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column8: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 8. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: not to cross unless they are with an adult.
column6: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column8: to know when it is safe to cross.
column10: to suddenly run into the street.

column2: 9. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column6: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column8: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column10: share the lane with another vehicle.

column2: 10. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the broken line may pass.
column8: next to the solid line may pass.

column2: 11. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column8: slow down.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column8: Mountain trail

column2: 13. When preparing to make a left turn from a two way street, drivers should drive:
column4: close to the right hand side of the road.
column8: on the left of the center line.

column2: 14. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column8: Crossroad ahead

column2: 16. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: No.

column2: 17. A flashing red light:
column6: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.
column8: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 18. Emergency vehicles:
column6: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
column8: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.

column2: 19. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column8: On slippery roads.

column2: 20. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column8: blue; white

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column8: Low clearance

column2: 22. The sign in the picture:
column4: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column10: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.

column2: 23. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column6: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.
column8: must yield the right-of-way.

column2: 24. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column8: turning right on red is forbidden.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column8: One-way traffic
column10: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 26. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column8: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 27. While driving, it is important to slow down:
column8: on narrow roads.

column2: 28. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column8: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

column2: 29. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.
column6: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.
column8: you should give yourself additional time to stop.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column8: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead

column2: 31. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.
column8: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.

column2: 32. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 33. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column8: No right turn

column2: 35. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column6: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column8: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
